item.title: Perfect teleports/--------/and defence problem
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

Why donâ€™t you make one method for all of em?

Instead of doing:

public void teleportHome() {
}
public void teleportVarrock() {
}
public void teleportFalador() {
}
public void teleportLumbrige() {
}

You could do:

public void teleportTo(String location, int X, int Y, int H){
    actionTimer = 5;
    teleportToX = X;
    teleportToY = Y;
    heightLevel = H;
    startAnimation(2263);
    sM("You teleport to "+location);
}

A command would look like this:

if(command.equals("varrock"){ teleportTo("Varrock", 2500, 2500, 0); }

Read full topic

item.title: Perfect teleports/--------/and defence problem
item.dc:creator: @I_AM_LEGEND I_AM_LEGEND
item.description:
@I_AM_LEGEND wrote:

with teleports i was guessing i would have to make a void for each one. and when i say teleports i mean command string teleports.
i want the teleport to take a bit of time and look sort of like the old one in runescape.
just off the top of my head i can create a code but there is something im missing.

public void teleporthome() { actionTimer = 5; teleportToX = 2848; teleportToY = 5086; heightLevel = 0; startAnimation(2263); sendMessage("You teleport to Home."); }
i dont know im a bad coder trying to find ways to make the game a bit more like runescape 2.

and also im stuck on how to make defence work. ive thought about pulling it out of a source but i wouldnt learn anything that way.

[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 01, 2010, 03:38:28 am[/size][hr]by the way i know the animation to the teleport is 714 i think. i was just using 2263 as an example.
